result.execSummary:
The defendant Gauge Robins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gauge Robins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gauge Robins was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Gauge Robins was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Gauge Robins was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with known felons or drug dealers, no known drug houses, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 3 1/2 years WSP; 18 months initial confinement w/credit for 231 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; on ct 2 the court imposes a total sentence of 3 1/2 years WSP consecutive to ct 1; 18 months initial confinement; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; on ct 4 the court imposes a total sentence of 3 1/2 years WSP concurrent to ct 2; 18 months initial confinement; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; submit DNA sample and pay $750 DNA surcharge.
rcv'd from Lorleen Karaway

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty C Lassiter appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Lassiter requests to adjourn sentencing as the deft wants to see the video discovery.  SEH adjourned to 1/29/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Lassiter and by approval of the court, the SEH of 11/25/14 at 1:30pm is rescheduled, as she needs time to go over PSI with him and he is at KCDC; reset to 12/18/14 at 2pm.
rcv'd from Sarah Martin

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 3 is dismissed and read in, cts 5, 6, 7 & 8 are dismissed; the enhancers of on or near a park on cts 1 & 2 are dismissed, the enhancer of on or near a youth center on ct 4 is dismissed.  Deft pleads no contest to cts 1, 2 & 4.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1, 2 & 4.  PSI ordered.  SEH 11/25/14 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards states she was just provided with an offer.  FPT continued to 10/14/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DA PTC 9/19/14 at 1:30pm and FPT continued to 9/22/14 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty C Lassiter appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Lassiter's motion to modify bond.  Court denies motion for reasons set forth on the record.
for bond modification; filed by Atty C Lassiter.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files information.  Atty Lassiter acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 8/15/14 at 1:30pm, FPT 9/4/14 at 9am, BBH 7/7/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6.  Arraignment 7/2/14 at 8:15.  Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
